db:abstract.db:para: The QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator class provides an authenticator object for Cross Origin Requests (CORS).
This class was introduced in Qt 5.3.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: The QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator class is used in the originAuthenticationRequired() signal. The class provides a way to pass back the required information to the QWebSocketServer. It provides applications with fine-grained control over which origin URLs are allowed and which aren't. By default, every origin is accepted. To get fine-grained control, an application connects the originAuthenticationRequired() signal to a slot. When the origin (QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::origin()) is accepted, it calls QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::setAllowed(true)

db:note.db:para: Checking on the origin does not make much sense when the server is accessed via a non-browser client, as that client can set whatever origin header it likes. In case of a browser client, the server SHOULD check the validity of the origin.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator(const QString &origin)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new QCorsAuthencator object with the given origin.

db:note.db:para: By default, allowed() returns true. This means that per default every origin is accepted.

db:section.db:title: QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator(QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-constructs a QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator, making it point at the same object other was pointing to.

db:section.db:title: bool QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::allowed() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the origin is allowed, otherwise returns false.

db:note.db:para: By default, all origins are accepted.

db:section.db:title: QString QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::origin() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the origin this autenticator is handling about.

db:section.db:title: void QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::setAllowed(bool allowed)
db:section.db:para: Allows or disallows the origin. Setting allowed to true, will accept the connection request for the given origin.
Setting allowed to false, will reject the connection request.

db:note.db:para: By default, all origins are accepted.

db:section.db:title: void QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::swap(QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator &other)
db:section.db:para: This operation is very fast and never fails.

db:section.db:title: QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator &QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator::operator=(const QWebSocketCorsAuthenticator &other)
db:section.db:para: Assigns other to this authenticator object.
